level.heading: Fraud in the first degree
level.text: A person commits the offense of fraud in the first degree if that person engages in a scheme or systematic course of conduct with intent to defraud or to obtain property of another by means of a false or fraudulent pretense, representation, or promise and thereby obtains property of another or causes another to lose property.

level.heading: Fraud in the second degree
level.text: A person commits the offense of fraud in the second degree if that person engages in a scheme or systematic course of conduct with intent to defraud or to obtain property of another by means of a false or fraudulent pretense, representation, or promise.

level.heading: False promise as to future performance
level.text: Fraud may be committed by means of false promise as to future performance which the accused does not intend to perform or knows will not be performed. An intent or knowledge shall not be established by the fact alone that one such promise was not performed.

level.heading: Section References
level.text: This section is referenced in § 22-3202, § 27-101, § 31-5606.04, and § 44-151.15.
